snippet.title: Dust to Dusk | RPG Maker Horror | No Commentary
snippet.description:
"You know nothing, Jun Tsukimiya."

Endings Gotten: 1/4

Game: Dust to Dusk (宵闇ノ影)
Find the game here: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1371770/_/
Original creator: C3 Games
Release Date: 2016 (2020 for English)
Engine: RPG Maker VX Ace
I do NOT own anything on this video, all credit to their respective creators.

If the creator wants me to take this down, please tell me.
もしクリエイターがこれを削除することを望むなら、私に言ってほしい。 (DeepL)

Synopsis:

Rumors are abound at the Tsukimiya Corporation about a child ghost that wanders the office halls. In fact, the hushed whispers and paranoia have grown so readily that the office now shuts it doors promptly at seven o'clock each night--the same hour this child comes out to play.

One night, Jun Tsukimiya, the corporation's chairman, oversleeps at his desk and is left alone on the cusp of dusk. And what does this child say to him when they finally meet?

"You know nothing, Jun Tsukimiya."

Just what is it that he doesn't know? Whatever it is, the clock is stuck at seven, and he has little choice but to find out.

Thoughts:

I found this originally on Freem! looking for... things and then I found out it was also translated into English and on Steam. Since I hadn't seen anyone talk about this game, I was like... why the hell not? 

It's more mystery than horror, and there is no way to get a game over, so it's a more relaxed experience. I did like it, but apparently, the game improves if you check out all the bonus stuff so... I'll do that... maybe.

I didn't get all the endings here since there was no walkthrough (well, there is but I only knew about it after recording. More excuse for you to play it, eh? There's bonus content behind getting all of them I think.)

If there's one game I'd recommend you check out yourself it's this one. I didn't go over a lot of the story and I think the context from the other endings is really good to know. 

Since this was my first playthrough I was unaware of what I had to do mostly. But after recording I did go back and do all the other things and I recommend you do too.

Cool game I'd say. The art is nice and I recommend you pick this up. It's only a buck so you won't lose much.
